channel.title: Projects on Thom.space
channel.description: Recent content in Projects on Thom.space

item.title: RoofMapper
item.description:
A tool that makes contributing to OpenStreetMap really accessible.

 

Running at www.roofmapper.eu.

 

This is an experiment in offering a way for non-computer-savvy people to contribute to the project. Here the user just has to select the building roof material, with the help of the aerial imagery, by clicking the corresponding button. When finished, the user clicks “upload” to send changes, and that’s all. Everything else, from the selection of the buildings to the changeset message, is taken care of automatically.

The tool is designed to be used with tablets, though it is fully usable on a desktop computer. (It can be used using the keyboard only.)

RoofMapper can also be used by seasoned mappers for quick contributions.

 

 

Source code:

  • Client repository
  • Server repository
  • Data extraction tool repository

Licence: MIT

item.title: Software Renderer
item.description:
A simple software renderer I made from scratch. (Except to get a drawable surface and input events, for which SDL is used. Everything else, including maths code, is hand-written.)

Features:

  • Vertex arrays
  • Z-buffer
  • Correct triangle clipping
  • Shader system with perspective-correct interpolation
  • Texture sampling
  • Pixels drawn in quads
  • OBJ file loading
  • FPS-style camera

 

 

 

Source code repository

Licence: MIT

item.title: Pasorikai
item.description:
A Japanese-to-English interactive dictionary for Windows. Based on a port of the Rikaichan Firefox extension. Uses Jim Breen’s WWWJDIC Japanese dictionary.

Features:

  • Automatically grabs text for the clipboard
  • Can be controlled without application focus, using keyboard hotkeys
  • Conjugated form to root form conversion
  • Kanji to kana conversion
  • Kanji details display
  • Results sorted by usage frequency

 

 

Source code repository

Licence: GPLv2
